instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used on the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils?
Output: On the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils,the researchers used visible spectrum and nir spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils?
Output: SG convolution smoothing (SG) and Z-score normalization were used as spectral feature processing methods on the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the classification performance on the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the classification performance of the microplastics detection models on the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils was the F1_score.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in the study on the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils using hyperspectral imaging (HSI) technology?
Output: The machine learning models used in the study on the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils using hyperspectral imaging (HSI) technology were Support Vector Machine (SVM), Back Propagation Neural Network (BPNN), and One-Dimensional Convolutional Neural Network (1DCNN).

instruction: Can hyperspectral imaging (HSI) technology and machine learning methodologies be considered superior to traditional methods for the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils, based on the experimental results and classification accuracy achieved in this study?
Output: Yes. Based on the experimental results and classification accuracy achieved in this study, hyperspectral imaging (HSI) technology and machine learning methodologies can be considered superior to traditional methods for the classification and detection of microplastics in farming soils. The study found that the best approaches based on three models (Isomap-SVM, Isomap-BPNN, and SPA-1D-CNN) achieved high accuracy, precision, recall, and F1_score values. Among them, SPA-1D-CNN had the best classification performance with a classification accuracy of 0.9500. This indicates that the combination of HSI technology and machine learning techniques can efficiently and accurately identify microplastics in farmland soils, providing theoretical backing and technical means for real-time detection of microplastics.
